title: Harassment: abusive language (private individual)
desc:
Definition: Targeted insults, epithets, or degrading remarks aimed at a private individual.
Includes: name-calling; profanity directed at a person; mockery of non-protected traits (appearance, job, hobbies).
Exclusions: Non-targeted profanity; criticism of actions/ideas without personal insults; satire not aimed at a private person.

title: Harassment: coordinated harassment / dogpiling
desc:
Definition: Organized or orchestrated effort to harass a target (private or public figure).
Includes: brigading via DMs/comments; call-to-action posts directing followers to attack; mass-tag harassment threads.
Signals: Same scripts/hashtags across many accounts; timing spikes; cross-linking to targets.
Exclusions: Good-faith mobilization to contact officials/businesses without harassment or personal attacks.

title: Harassment: doxxing / PII exposure
desc:
Definition: Sharing someone’s private, identifying, or contact information with intent to harass or cause harm.
PII Examples: home/work address, phone, personal email, SSN, financial IDs, geo coordinates, private photos of residence.
Exclusions: Public-interest journalism using already public official information; user’s own info; consented sharing.

title: Hate speech: directed attack (protected class)
desc:
Definition: Attacks against a protected class or its members (race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, serious disease).
Includes: slurs; demeaning metaphors; calls to harm or exclude the class; targeting individuals based on protected attribute.
Exclusions: Neutral/academic discussion of hateful speech; reclaimed self-referential use (context sensitive).

title: Sexual content: pornography / explicit sex acts
desc:
Definition: Explicit sexual acts or pornographic content meant for arousal.
Includes: visible sex acts; explicit masturbation; explicit sexual services demos; porn thumbnails/clips.
Exclusions: Sexual health education without explicit imagery; non-sexual medical content.

title: Sexual content: solicitation of sexual services
desc:
Definition: Offers/requests to buy, sell, trade, or facilitate sexual services.
Includes: escort ads; “PPV” sexual service offers; transactional language (“rates/booking”); third-party brokering.
Exclusions: Dating without transactional language; adult content creators linking to compliant platforms without explicit service offers.

title: Nudity: visible genitalia (non-medical)
desc:
Definition: Visible genitalia presented outside clear medical/educational context.
Includes: close-ups; transparent/see-through garments revealing genitals; erection outline intended as sexual display.
Exclusions: Medical or educational imagery; clinical documentation; newsworthy health reporting presented in a non-sexual way.

title: Nudity: female nipples (non-exempt)
desc:
Definition: Visible female nipples outside exempt scenarios.
Includes: erotic posing with nipple visibility; content intended for arousal.
Exclusions: Breastfeeding, childbirth/after-birth moments, post-mastectomy, bona fide medical or educational contexts.

title: Nudity: adult sexualized nudity (non-explicit)
desc:
Definition: Sexualized posing or erotic nudity without explicit sex acts.
Includes: full or partial nudity with sexual framing; striptease imagery; fetish attire centered on nudity.
Exclusions: Non-sexual artistic nudity with no genitalia/female nipples shown; medical/educational contexts.

title: Impersonation: private individual
desc:
Definition: Pretending to be a private person with the intent to mislead audiences.
Includes: copying name/photo/bio to misrepresent identity; impersonating acquaintances, victims, or witnesses.
Exclusions: Clear parody with disclaimers and no realistic risk of confusion.

title: Impersonation: public figure/brand
desc:
Definition: Misrepresenting a public figure, organization, or brand to deceive.
Includes: fake CEO/celebrity accounts; spoofed brand support profiles; phishing via brand impersonation.
Exclusions: Clear parody labeled in handle/bio and content; fan accounts that do not claim official status.

title: Deceptive badges/official insignia
desc:
Definition: Misuse or fabrication of verification marks, government/official seals, or “official” labels to imply authority.
Includes: fake checkmarks; altered badges; “official” in handle when not authorized.

title: Non-consensual surveillance/recordings
desc:
Definition: Covert capture or distribution of someone’s private activity without consent (non-sexual).
Includes: hidden cameras in private spaces; recording private conversations; stalking-style drone footage of a residence.
Exclusions: Public-interest reporting in public spaces; recordings where there is no reasonable expectation of privacy (jurisdiction dependent).

title: Sharing hacked/leaked personal content
desc:
Definition: Posting someone’s personal content obtained through hacking/leaks (non-intimate).
Includes: private emails, cloud file dumps, financial docs; non-public contact lists.
Exclusions: Public documents or info released with consent; verified whistleblowing with strong public-interest defense (requires legal review).

title: Spam: mass unsolicited posting / flooding
desc:
Definition: Bulk or repetitive posting that clutters feeds or replies and degrades user experience.
Includes: comment/reply floods; duplicate threads; auto-post loops.

title: Spam: malicious/deceptive links
desc:
Definition: Links intended to trick users into harmful actions or sites.
Includes: clickjacking; drive-by downloads; phishing landing pages; obfuscated redirect chains.

title: Spam: repetitive commercial promotion
desc:
Definition: Repetitive marketing/messages posted across surfaces without genuine context.
Includes: multi-post affiliate drops; chain messages; coupon blast bots.

title: Spam: fake engagement
desc:
Definition: Buying, selling, or coordinating artificial likes, comments, follows, votes, or reposts.
Includes: engagement pods; marketplaces for reactions; scripted comment bots.

title: Spam: fake/misleading account creation
desc:
Definition: Sockpuppets/mass accounts created to mislead or evade enforcement.
Includes: identity-masking farms; account aging for resale; rapid signups from same device/IP with evasion.

title: Spam: abuse of reporting/moderation tools
desc:
Definition: Coordinated or bad-faith use of report tools to silence or harass.
Includes: brigading reports; mass false flags; scripts to auto-report targets.

title: Misinformation: harmful health claims
desc:
Definition: Claims that could directly cause health harm or delay care.
Includes: false cures; anti-vaccine disinformation with harm framing; dangerous dosing advice.
Exclusions: Personal anecdotes framed as opinion; good-faith discussion with authoritative citations.

title: Misinformation: civic processes
desc:
Definition: False claims that suppress or mislead participation in civic processes.
Includes: wrong election dates/locations; fake registration requirements; misstatements about eligibility.
Exclusions: Clear satire; opinion about policies without procedural claims.

title: Misinformation: emergencies/public safety
desc:
Definition: False claims about disasters, evacuations, shelter/aid, or public safety instructions.
Includes: fake evacuation routes; false active-shooter alerts; fabricated boil-water advisories.

title: Harassment: threats (non-credible)
desc:
Definition: Stated intent to cause harm without specific means/target details; or obviously hyperbolic.
Includes: “I’ll beat you up” without plan; vague threats to “make you pay.”
Note: If target + means are specific and appear credible, consider 404.1 (Tier 4).

title: Harassment: severe bullying / psychological harm
desc:
Definition: Sustained harassment aiming to degrade, isolate, or cause mental harm.
Includes: humiliation campaigns; targeting known vulnerabilities; coordinated shaming.

title: Hate speech: exclusion/segregation
desc:
Definition: Calls to exclude, deport, segregate, or remove rights from protected classes.
Includes: “Keep them out,” “They shouldn’t be allowed to vote,” “Separate schools/areas.”

title: Hate speech: dehumanizing language
desc:
Definition: Describing a protected class as subhuman, animals, filth, disease.
Includes: vermin/parasite tropes; disease metaphors; genetic degradation claims.

title: Violence: graphic gore/death (shock/glorification)
desc:
Definition: Graphic portrayals of serious injury or death posted for shock value or to glorify violence.
Includes: beheadings; dismemberment; crushed bodies; cheering on gore.
Exclusions: News/reporting with clear intent to inform, appropriate warnings, and no glorification (context review needed).

title: Violence: encouraging dangerous stunts/challenges
desc:
Definition: Promotion of activities likely to cause serious injury.
Includes: asphyxiation games; ingestion challenges; roof/train surfing.

title: Violence: animal cruelty
desc:
Definition: Graphic or celebratory depictions of cruelty or torture toward animals.
Includes: staged harm; blood sports; “prank” cruelty that causes suffering.
Exclusions: Documentary/reporting intended to condemn cruelty, presented clearly as educational/news.

title: Fraud: financial scams
desc:
Definition: Deceptive schemes to obtain money/credentials.
Includes: phishing; fake investment multipliers; giveaway scams; refund/buyer-fraud playbooks.

title: Fraud: identity theft/impersonation for fraud
desc:
Definition: Using another’s identity or stolen data to defraud.
Includes: SIM swapping guides; KYC bypass kits; SSN+DoB combos.

title: Fraud: sale of counterfeit goods
desc:
Definition: Marketing or selling fakes as genuine.
Includes: luxury knockoffs; fake tickets; forged certifications.

title: Regulated goods: illegal drugs/paraphernalia
desc:
Definition: Sale or trade of illegal drugs; distribution facilitation.
Includes: DMs for prices; shipping instructions; paraphernalia marketed for illegal use.

title: Regulated goods: firearms/explosives/weapons
desc:
Definition: Sale or trade of weapons, ammo, explosives without allowed frameworks.
Includes: private sales; “DM for Glock”; conversion kits; ghost gun parts.

title: Regulated goods: unregulated medical products
desc:
Definition: Selling unapproved medical products/supplements with health claims.
Includes: miracle cures; unlicensed pharmacies; injectable compounds without Rx.

title: Regulated goods: human remains/organs
desc: Definition: Sale/trafficking of human remains or organs outside legal/ethical frameworks.

title: Regulated goods: unlicensed gambling
desc:
Definition: Operating or promoting gambling without required licenses.
Includes: illegal sportsbooks; lottery/raffle scams; crypto casinos without licensing.

title: Manipulation: coordinated inauthentic behavior (CIB)
desc:
Definition: Use of networks of fake/compromised accounts to mislead or amplify narratives.
Signals: central control; shared infrastructure; synchronized posting; persona reuse.

title: Manipulation: deceptive deepfakes
desc:
Definition: Synthetic or manipulated media presented as real to mislead.
Includes: fabricated speech/actions; swapped faces misleading about events.
Exclusions: Satire/parody clearly labeled and unlikely to cause confusion.

title: Manipulation: foreign interference
desc:
Definition: State/foreign-backed operations to influence civic outcomes on-platform.
Includes: astro-turfing; front media outlets; covert ad buys.

title: Crime how-to: non-terror offenses
desc:
Definition: Instructions to commit crimes (non-terror), or materially facilitate such crimes.
Includes: burglary guides; credit card skimming; catalytic converter theft tips.

title: Crime how-to: illegal drug manufacturing
desc:
Definition: Instructions to produce illegal drugs or precursors.
Includes: step-by-step cook guides; precursor sourcing; lab safety workarounds.

title: Violence & incitement: directed threats
desc:
Definition: Threats naming a target with some specifics but lacking verified capability.
Includes: “I will find you at [place]”; “We’re coming for you” with date/place.
Note: If specific target + means and credible, consider 404.1 (Tier 4).

title: Violence & incitement: praise/glorification
desc:
Definition: Praising past violent acts or perpetrators; celebrating harm.
Includes: cheering attacks; “they deserved it,” martyr posters for attackers.

title: Violence & incitement: support for violent movements
desc:
Definition: Support for groups advocating violence that are not designated terrorist orgs.
Includes: logos/flags with praise; recruitment language.

title: Sexual exploitation: non-consensual intimate imagery
desc:
Definition: Sharing intimate imagery without consent (NCI, “revenge porn”).
Includes: private nudes; leaked intimate videos; threats to expose (if extortive, see 302.2).

title: Sexual exploitation: sextortion
desc:
Definition: Sexual extortion demanding images, acts, or money under threat.
Includes: “pay or I leak your nudes”; blackmail with intimate materials.

title: Sexual exploitation: grooming (adult target)
desc:
Definition: Predatory sexual grooming of adults (manipulation/coercion patterns).
Includes: escalating demands; isolating tactics; exploiting vulnerabilities to obtain sexual content.

title: Sexual exploitation: voyeuristic imagery
desc:
Definition: Hidden or non-consensual sexualized imagery such as upskirt/downblouse.
Includes: covert filming in changing rooms/restrooms; creepshots of intimate areas.

title: Platform security: selling/trading accounts/credentials
desc:
Definition: Trafficking of accounts, sessions, tokens, or access passes.
Includes: OTP/2FA bypass sales; session cookies; “aged” accounts marketplace.

title: Platform security: botnets/scraping
desc:
Definition: Operating at-scale automation to scrape or interact abusively.
Includes: headless farms; captcha-solving rings; massive data exfiltration.

title: Platform security: bypassing security/exploits
desc:
Definition: Attempting or sharing methods to exploit platform security.
Includes: SQL/JS injection payloads; CSRF kits; auth bypass PoCs meant for misuse.
Exclusions: Coordinated vulnerability disclosure via official channels.

title: Self-harm: encouragement/instructions
desc:
Definition: Content encouraging or instructing suicide or self-harm.
Includes: “here’s how to do it”; challenges promoting self-harm.
Exclusions: Recovery stories; crisis support; harm-minimizing resources.

title: Eating disorders: pro-ED facilitation
desc:
Definition: Content that promotes, instructs, or communities organized to maintain ED behaviors.
Includes: “tips/tricks,” starve challenges, purging guides.
Exclusions: Recovery/awareness or support content.

title: Child sexual exploitation: CSAM
desc:
Definition: Any child sexual abuse material in any format (images, video, audio, text).
Includes: production, possession, sharing, or solicitation of CSAM.
Exclusions: None.

title: Child sexual exploitation: sexualization of minors
desc:
Definition: Sexualized depictions of minors, including AI-generated/drawn content or content presenting young-looking persons as minors.
Includes: fetishization of minors; sexualized commentary on minors’ bodies.
Exclusions: None.

title: Child sexual exploitation: grooming/solicitation of minors
desc:
Definition: Predatory attempts to obtain sexual content/meetings from minors.
Includes: requests for nudes; coercion; age misrepresentation to target minors.
Exclusions: None.

title: Terrorism: propaganda (graphic/recruiting)
desc:
Definition: Praise, support, or propaganda for designated terrorist organizations.
Includes: recruitment narratives; martyrdom posters; operational glorification.
Exclusions: None.

title: Terrorism: recruitment/fundraising
desc:
Definition: Soliciting personnel or funds for designated terrorist groups.
Includes: donation instructions; membership vetting calls; funnel links.
Exclusions: None.

title: Terrorism: instructional content
desc:
Definition: Operational instructions that facilitate terrorist attacks (weapons, explosives, tactics).
Exclusions: None.

title: Human exploitation: trafficking
desc:
Definition: Facilitating or promoting human trafficking (labor or sex).
Includes: recruitment/transport/harboring; control tactics; brokering.
Exclusions: None.

title: Human exploitation: forced labor facilitation
desc:
Definition: Content enabling forced labor or exploitation (including debt bondage).
Includes: coercive employment schemes; document confiscation tactics.
Exclusions: None.

title: Credible threats: specific target + means
desc:
Definition: Specific threats naming a target and plausible means/timing, or demonstrating apparent capability.
Includes: weapon display + direct threat; doxx + “coming at [time].”
Exclusions: None.

title: Credible threats: coordinated real-world planning
desc:
Definition: Coordinated planning for real-world violence with concrete logistics (targets, weapons, dates, roles).
Includes: attack planning docs; logistics chats; supply lists and assignments.
Exclusions: None.

title: Platform compromise: hacking/system intrusion
desc:
Definition: Attempts to gain unauthorized access to platform systems or user accounts.
Includes: credential stuffing; token theft; exploiting internal tools.
Exclusions: None.

title: Platform compromise: malware distribution
desc:
Definition: Hosting/distributing malware, droppers, or C2 tooling.
Includes: payload links; infected installers; “builder” kits.
Exclusions: None.

title: Platform compromise: credential harvesting (at scale)
desc:
Definition: Systematic harvesting of credentials via phishing kits, fake portals, or automation.
Includes: full-kit sales; large credential dumps; phish campaigns.
Exclusions: None.
